definitions.definition: A visible, narrow, and intense (relative to ambient light) ray of sunlight.
An item of cutlery or crockery laid out on a table, but not used, and which can be returned to the drawer without being washed.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies of the genus Curetis.
Any hummingbird of the genus Aglaeactis.
The direct rays, light or warmth of the sun.
definitions.example: We were warmed by the bright sunshine.

definitions.definition: A location on which the sun's rays fall.
definitions.example: We moved out of the shade and into the sunshine.
I enjoyed the sunshine of her smile.

definitions.definition: A source of cheerfulness or joy.
The effect which the sun has when it lights and warms some place.
Friendly form of address often reserved for juniors.
definitions.example: Alright sunshine, safe to cross now.

definitions.definition: Ironic form of address used to an inferior or troublemaker.
definitions.example: OK, sunshine, listen up and listen good. There's five vandalised telephone boxes out there and I know you're responsible.

definitions.definition: Used to address someone who has just woken up and/or is very sleepy.
